359 AM CST FRI JAN 2 2015

...ICE STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST SATURDAY...

THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE IN NORMAN HAS ISSUED AN ICE STORM
WARNING...WHICH IS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST SATURDAY. THE WINTER
WEATHER ADVISORY IS NO LONGER IN EFFECT. 

* TIMING: TODAY AND TONIGHT THROUGH SUNRISE SATURDAY.

* MAIN IMPACT: FREEZING RAIN WILL RESULT IN ICE ACCUMULATIONS OF
  MORE THAN ONE QUARTER OF AN INCH ON BRIDGES...TREES... POWER
  LINES AND ELEVATED SURFACES. ICE ACCUMULATION WILL BE NEAR ONE-
  HALF INCH IN SOME LOCATIONS. ICE WILL ALSO ACCUMULATE ON
  ROADS... ESPECIALLY IN WESTERN SECTIONS OF OKLAHOMA AND NORTH
  TEXAS.

PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...

DO NOT TRAVEL! BE SURE YOU CAN TAKE CARE OF YOURSELF AND YOUR
FAMILY IF YOU LOSE ELECTRICAL POWER. WATCH OUT FOR FALLING
TREES...LIMBS AND POWER LINES.

PAULS VALLEY...SULPHUR...ARDMORE
359 AM CST FRI JAN 2 2015

...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST SATURDAY...

THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE IN NORMAN HAS ISSUED A WINTER
WEATHER ADVISORY FOR FREEZING RAIN AND SLEET...WHICH IS IN EFFECT
UNTIL 6 AM CST SATURDAY.

* TIMING: TODAY AND TONIGHT THROUGH SUNRISE SATURDAY.

* MAIN IMPACT: FREEZING RAIN WILL RESULT IN ICE ACCUMULATIONS OF
  AROUND ONE TENTH OF AN INCH THROUGH 6 AM SATURDAY ON
  TREES...POWER LINES...BRIDGES AND OTHER ELEVATED SURFACES.

* OTHER IMPACTS: LIGHT ICING MAY OCCUR ON BRIDGES...OVERPASSES...AND
  OTHER EXPOSED ROADWAYS...RESULTING IN HAZARDOUS DRIVING
  CONDITIONS IN SOME AREAS. SLEET WILL ALSO BE POSSIBLE IN WESTERN
  AND NORTHERN OKLAHOMA. TEMPERATURES MAY WARM ENOUGH FOR THE
  FREEZING RAIN TO TEMPORARILY CHANGE TO RAIN TODAY ACROSS SOUTH
  CENTRAL OKLAHOMA... BUT THEN FREEZING RAIN MAY REDEVELOP AS
  TEMPERATURES COOL THIS EVENING.

PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...

BE CAREFUL IF YOU HAVE TO TRAVEL. EVEN SMALL AMOUNTS OF ICE AND
SNOW CAN MAKE ROADS AND SIDEWALKS SLICK AND DANGEROUS.

...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST SATURDAY...

THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE IN NORMAN HAS ISSUED A WINTER
WEATHER ADVISORY FOR FREEZING RAIN... SLEET AND SNOW...WHICH IS
IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST SATURDAY.

* TIMING: LATE THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNSET SATURDAY.
  PRECIPITATION WILL LIKELY DEVELOP AS FREEZING RAIN OR SLEET
  BEFORE CHANGING TO SNOW OVERNIGHT. 

* MAIN IMPACT: FREEZING RAIN WILL RESULT IN THE CHANCE OF SOME ICE
  ACCUMULATIONS OF AROUND ONE TENTH OF AN INCH THIS EVENING ON
  TREES...POWER LINES...AND OTHER ELEVATED SURFACES. SNOWFALL OF
  ONE TO THREE INCHES IS EXPECTED LATE THIS EVENING THROUGH
  SATURDAY.

PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...

BE CAREFUL IF YOU HAVE TO TRAVEL. EVEN SMALL AMOUNTS OF ICE AND
SNOW CAN MAKE ROADS AND SIDEWALKS SLICK AND DANGEROUS.
